item.title: Exploration of business systems in Asia
item.description:
Source: OUP. “The Oxford Handbook of Asian Business Systems”, edited by Michael Witt and Gordon Redding, is the first publication to examine business systems from India to Japan. Oxford University Press, the book’s publisher, states that existing research on “varieties of capitalism” (VOC) and “comparative business systems” heavily emphasizes Europe, Japan, and Anglo-Saxon countries. This book is the first to offer a thorough analysis of the institutional frameworks of most Asian countries and assess the applicability of current theories within the Asian context...

item.title: The Handbook on Marriages of Convenience by the Commission
item.description:
Alina Tryfonidou, Associate Professor in EU Law, School of Law, University of Reading In September 2014, the Commission introduced a Handbook designed to guide Member States in addressing marriages of convenience between EU citizens and non-EU nationals. The goal is to combat these marriages without unduly restricting the free movement rights of EU citizens. The Commission emphasizes that the guidelines, developed in collaboration with Member States, are not legally binding and don’t supersede existing EU law or its future interpretations...
